content: The various modes of worship which prevailed in the Roman world were all considered by the people as equally true; by the philosopher as equally false; and by the magistrate as equally useful. And thus toleration produced not only mutual indulgence, but even religious concord.
translations: ita:Le diverse forme di culto che esistevano nel mondo romano erano tutte considerate dal popolo egualmente vere, dai filoso
credits: Sentence from Tatoeba by Scott (CC-BY 2.0 FR)
